verses.roman:
kṛtvā tāvantam ātmānaṁ
yāvatīr gopa-yoṣitaḥ
reme sa bhagavāṁs tābhir
ātmārāmo 'pi līlayā

synonyms: kṛtvā—making; tāvantam—expanded that many times; ātmānam—Himself; yāvatīḥ—as many as; gopa-yoṣitaḥ—cowherd women; reme—enjoyed; saḥ—He; bhagavān—the Supreme Lord; tābhiḥ—with them; ātma-ārāmaḥ—self-satisfied; api—although; līlayā—as a pastime.
translation: Expanding Himself us many times as there were cowherd women to associate with, the Supreme Lord, though self-satisfied, playfully enjoyed their company.

purport.content: As Śrīla Viśvanātha Cakravartī points out, it has already been explained that Lord Kṛṣṇa is eternally free from all material desire, perfect on the platform of spiritual self-satisfaction.
